introduction:
What is the Antibiotic Apocalypse? What is it all about? And how dangerous is it?


OUR CHANNELS
▀▀▀

vocabulary.definition: a strain of bacteria that has become resistant to the antibiotics commonly used to treat it
vocabulary.example: The hospital is currently dealing with an outbreak of a superbug that is proving difficult to eradicate.

vocabulary.definition: a bacterium that has evolved resistance to multiple antibiotics
vocabulary.example: Scientists are concerned about the emergence of a superbacterium that could pose a serious threat to public health.

vocabulary.definition: the ability of an organism to resist a particular infection or toxin by the action of specific antibodies or sensitized white blood cells
vocabulary.example: Some individuals have natural immunity to certain diseases, while others may require vaccination for protection.

vocabulary.definition: small, circular DNA molecules that are separate from the chromosomal DNA and can replicate independently
vocabulary.example: The bacteria exchanged plasmids, transferring the gene for antibiotic resistance.

vocabulary.definition: a raw material or primary agricultural product that can be bought and sold, such as copper or coffee
vocabulary.example: Oil is one of the most widely traded commodities in the world.

vocabulary.definition: no longer produced or used; out of date
vocabulary.example: With the advancement of technology, many devices become obsolete within a few years.
